FuncDef: The reset igmp control-message counters command deletes statistics about IGMP messages.
CLIs: reset igmp { vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | all-instance } control-message counters [ interface { <port-type> <port-num> | <interface-name> } ] [ message-type { query | report } ]
reset igmp control-message counters [ interface { <port-type> <port-num> | <interface-name> } ] [ message-type { query | report } ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of case-sensitive characters.

Specifies the type of an interface.
-

Specifies the number of an interface.
-

Specifies the name of an interface.
-

Indicates an IGMP message type.
An IGMP message can a Query or Report message.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset igmp control-message counters interface GigabitEthernet 1/0/0
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before using the reset igmp control-message counters command, note the following:
If neither vpn-instance nor all-instance is specified, the command deletes statistics about IGMP messages in the public network instance.If interface is specified, the command deletes statistics about IGMP messages on the specified interface.If both message-type and interface are specified, the command deletes statistics about a specified type of IGMP messages on the specified interface.
Deleting statistics about IGMP messages does not affect the normal running status of IGMP.
